arm_group.description: RA patients treated by Orencia according to usual practice from June 1st 2007

brief_summary.textblock:
Database analysis:

        -  To describe how Orencia is prescribed in France in Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA)

        -  To describe joint population of Orencia

        -  To assess the impact of the treatment on health status of the treated population as
           assessed by morbid-mortality criteria

        -  To describe therapeutic strategies and use of health services

clinical_study.brief_title: Description of Joint Population and Assessment of Impact on Health Status of Orencia in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis in France. A Database Analysis Based on SFR's ORA Long-term Cohort Study
clinical_study.condition: Patients Diagnosed With a Rheumatoid Arthritis According to ACR Criteria (American College of Rheumatology)

detailed_description.textblock:
-  Observational Model: Historic cohort generated from Société Française de Rhumatologie's
           (SFR) Orencia and Rheumatoid Arthritis (ORA) registry

        -  Sampling Method: all physicians and sites taking in charge RA patients received an
           invitation mailing to participate to ORA

        -  Minimum Age: 18 years old at Orencia initiation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adult outpatients, male or female aged ≥ 18 years old

          -  Diagnosed with a rheumatoid arthritis according to ACR criteria

          -  Treated with Orencia according to usual practice conditions from June 1st 2007

          -  Agreeing to participate

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients treated by Orencia in the context of clinical trials

study_pop.textblock: Patients included in SFR's ORA Registry

clinical_study.official_title: Description of Joint Population and Assessment of Impact on Health Status of Orencia in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis in France. A Database Analysis Based on SFR's ORA Long-term Cohort Study

oversight_info.authority: France: Haute Autorité de Santé Transparency Commission

primary_outcome.description:
Change from DAS28 [C - reactive protein (CRP) and erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR)] measured at treatment initiation ≥ 1.2
DAS28 will be measured every 6 months during 5 years
primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with first clinically significant Disease Activity Score (DAS) change

primary_outcome.description: EULAR response will be measured every 6 months during 5 years
primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with first response to treatment [according to definition of European League Against Rheumatism  (EULAR) response criteria]

primary_outcome.description:
Change from DAS28 [C - reactive protein (CRP) and erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR)] measured at treatment initiation ≤ 3.2
DAS28 will be measured every 6 months during 5 years
primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with first Low Disease Activity State (LDAS)

primary_outcome.description:
Change from DAS28 [C - reactive protein (CRP) and erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR)] measured at treatment initiation <2.6
DAS28 will be measured every 6 months during 5 years
primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with first Remission state
Number of patients disease progression with prior improvement
Number of patients disease progression with no prior improvement
Number of patients with modification of Orencia administration condition
Number of patients discontinued and switched from Orencia
Incidence rate of any type of Adverse events related to Orencia

primary_outcome.description: Predefined events are severe infection, thromboembolic events, cancer, lymphoma, other autoimmune disease, cutaneous disorder, significant or persistent disability, death
primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with specific predefined events
Response over the time will be assessed over 5 years on EULAR response, LDAS

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
